normalised: So, I've been practicing yoga on and off for years, but lately I've been diving deeper, exploring it beyond just the physical postures (asanas). Turns out, it's a whole lifestyle, not just something you do for an hour in your living room (although, that's a great start!).

unnormalised: So, I've been practicing yoga on and off for years, but lately I've been diving deeper, exploring it beyond just the physical postures (asanas). Turns out, it's a whole lifestyle, not just something you do for an hour in your living room (although, that's a great start!).
normalised: My grandmother, Ammaji, always told me, "Yoga is a way of life, beta!" And she's right. It includes things like pranayama (breathing techniques) – seriously underrated, especially when you're stuck in Delhi traffic. Even simple practices like alternate nostril breathing can do wonders.

normalised: I've also been reading up on the Yamas and Niyamas, the ethical guidelines in yoga philosophy. It’s fascinating stuff! Think about honesty (Satya) and contentment (Santosha). Really makes you think about how you’re living your life, right?

normalised: For me, practicing yoga has improved not only my flexibility (which, let's be honest, was practically zero before!) but also my mental wellbeing. I feel less stressed, more present, and generally happier. Plus, my back pain (thanks to sitting at a desk all day) has decreased significantly. My little balcony space (around eighty square feet) is my peaceful haven now.
